questions.question_text: A project manager is discussing with team members sensitive project information that should not be disclosed outside of the office. Which of the following BEST describes this type of information?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C - Sensitive project information that should not be disclosed outside of the office is typically referred to as a "trade secret." Trade secrets encompass confidential business information, practices, or processes that provide a competitive advantage to a company. It's important to safeguard trade secrets to maintain a competitive edge and protect proprietary information from unauthorized disclosure.

Selected Answer: D
D - Key performance indicators (KPIs) are the most beneficial tools for assessing whether a project has met its defined objectives. KPIs are specific, measurable metrics that are aligned with the project's goals. They provide a clear and quantitative way to evaluate project performance and determine whether the project has achieved its intended outcomes. While schedule variance and cost variance are important measures, KPIs offer a more comprehensive view of the project's success in meeting its objectives.

questions.question_text: Which of the following would be the MOST beneficial to determine whether a project has met the defined objectives?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Developing a schedule in Project+:
• Identify Tasks
• Estimate Durations
• Sequence Tasks
• Resource Requirements
• Allocate Resources
• Create Schedule
• Validate
• Set Baselines
• Document/Communicate
• Monitor/Update

Selected Answer: D
Chat GPT says D. I think its reasoning is solid. 
During the scheduling phase, the project manager may review the planned schedule, adjust task durations, sequences, dependencies, and resource assignments as necessary to ensure feasibility and alignment with project objectives. Establishing baselines during the scheduling phase involves setting the schedule baseline, which includes freezing the schedule to reflect the agreed-upon plan against which actual progress will be measured.

Therefore, even though establishing baselines is typically associated with the planning phase, it's also an essential activity during the scheduling phase to complete and formalize the project schedule before moving into execution and monitoring phases.

Selected Answer: A
You've already established baselines by outlining the duration. Now we just need to assign someone to the work.

Selected Answer: A
The answer is A, allocate resources. 
See Comptia Project+ section 1.6 Execute and Develop Project Schedules. 
Allocation of resources comes before setting baselines.

Selected Answer: D
Answer: D (please disregard my other comment, selected wrong answer and it will not allow me to delete) Resources cannot be allocated until baselines are established. In other words, how would the PM know how much each section needs from a limited resource pool if it is unknown (even in estimate) how much is considered adequate?

comments.content: This is done in the planning phase not the scheduling phase. Meaning it’s already been done by this point.
I passed this exam with a near perfect score using the answers from here. Unfortunetly, the answer to this question is still D based on the logic given above to explain the answer.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Resources cannot be allocated until baselines are established. In other words, how would the PM know how much each section needs from a limited resource pool if it is unknown (even in estimate) how much is considered adequate?

Selected Answer: A
Although the project manager has validated constraints, outlined durations, and confirmed sequencing, the schedule is not complete until resources have been allocated. This involves assigning the necessary personnel, equipment, and materials to each task, ensuring that they are available when needed and that their use is optimized.

Selected Answer: A
Agree, answer is A - you have to assign resources during the development of the project schedule.

Selected Answer: A
A. Allocate resources still needs to be performed to complete the project schedule.

Developing a project schedule involves identifying the tasks, estimating their duration and sequencing them in the proper order. Once the tasks have been sequenced, the project manager needs to allocate resources to each task to ensure that the tasks are adequately staffed to complete them as outlined in the schedule. Resource allocation also ensures that the project is staffed with the right skills and that the resources are working on the right tasks at the correct levels of effort.

questions.question_text: By developing a project schedule, a PM has already validated the constraints, outlined the duration of the tasks and the phases, and confirmed the proper sequence and flow of the project. Which of the following activities still needs to be performed to complete the schedule?

A project manager is working on a project charter and has successfully documented the project objectives and the success criteria. Which of the following should the project manager define NEXT to complete the project charter?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B - After documenting the project objectives and success criteria, the next step in completing the project charter is to define the preliminary scope statement. This statement outlines the high-level boundaries and deliverables of the project, helping to provide a clear understanding of what the project will and will not involve. Once the scope is defined, other aspects like proposed solution design, responsibility assignment matrix, and initial budget baseline can be developed in alignment with the project's scope and objectives.

questions.question_text: A project has been initiated to provide insurance forms for a company. A constraint for this project is that the insurance commission in each state where the company underwrites has to approve each form. Which of the following compliance considerations BEST describes this scenario?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A - This aligns with regulatory impacts, as it pertains to compliance with legal and regulatory requirements specific to the insurance industry and the approval processes mandated by the insurance commissions. Regulatory impacts refer to the effects of adhering to laws, regulations, and standards that apply to a particular project or organization.
